metadata.dc:author: Abengozar García-Moreno, A
Cabello Padial, J
Rodríguez Rincón, J P
Sevilla Zabaleta, M
Cuervo Pinna, C
Laguna Alvarez, E
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To describe an additional case of congenital bulbous urethra. The incidence, etiopathogenesis, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment of this condition are discussed. METHODS A 16-year-old male consulted at the emergency services for urinary retention and a perineal lesion. Patient evaluation included ultrasound, retrograde and voiding urethrocystography. Treatment was by open surgery. RESULTS The patient was evaluated at 3, 6 and 12 months. He remains asymptomatic and control urethrograms are normal. CONCLUSIONS Open surgery is advocated as the treatment of choice for symptomatic diverticulum of a considerable size.
metadata.dc:title: Divertículo de uretra bulbar congénito.
[A congenital diverticulum of the bulbar urethra].
